original: thog mar zhes bya ba ni dang por ro //
analyzed: thog mar zhes bya ba ni dang por ro //
translated: First means at the beginning.

original: sa ni yongs su sbyong zhes bya ba ni mtho ba dang dma' ba'i skyon bzlog pa dang / zug rngu phyung bas khang bzangs 'dzin pa'i nus pa dang ldan par byed do //
analyzed: sa ni yongs su sbyong zhes bya ba ni mtho ba dang dma' ba'i skyon bzlog pa dang / zug rngu phyung bas khang bzangs 'dzin pa'i nus pa dang ldan par byed do //
translated: The purification of the ground means that it is made capable of bearing the palace by removing the faults of high and low and by extracting stumps.

original: de dang zhes bya ba ni yongs su sbyangs pa'i sa'i steng du'o //
analyzed: de dang zhes bya ba ni yongs su sbyangs pa'i sa'i steng du'o //

original: bgegs dang bral byas la zhes bya ba ni sa'i lha dang / 'byung po la sogs pa'i bgegs nye bar zhi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bgegs dang bral byas la zhes bya ba ni sa'i lha dang / 'byung po la sogs pa'i bgegs nye bar zhi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Having made it free from obstacles means that it is for the sake of pacifying the obstacles of the earth gods, bhutas, etc.

original: legs par dag par bya ba ni sbyin sreg dang gtor ma la sogs pas legs par dag par byas pa'o //
analyzed: legs par dag par bya ba ni sbyin sreg dang gtor ma la sogs pas legs par dag par byas pa'o //

original: khang bzangs zhes bya ba ni khang pa'o //
analyzed: khang bzangs zhes bya ba ni khang pa'o //

original: skal bzang zhes bya ba ni tshad bzang po nyid kyis shin tu bkra shis pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: skal bzang zhes bya ba ni tshad bzang po nyid kyis shin tu bkra shis pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

analyzed: 'od zer kha dog ser po sna bug gnyis ka nas rgyu'o //
translated: and the light rays of the color yellow flow from both nostrils.

original: thun bzhi pa la snying ga'i padmar gnas pa'i chu'i dkyil 'khor las 'od zer kha dog dkar po sna bug gnyis ka nas dal gyis rgyu bar byed do //
analyzed: thun bzhi pa la snying ga'i padmar gnas pa'i chu'i dkyil 'khor las 'od zer kha dog dkar po sna bug gnyis ka nas dal gyis rgyu bar byed do //
translated: In the fourth period, the water ma·πá·∏çala located at the heart lotus causes the light rays of the color white to flow slowly from both nostrils.

original: mtshan mo la yang de @91a * //
analyzed: mtshan mo la yang de @91a * //
translated: This is also the case at night.

original: bzhin du'o // 'di yang dkyil 'khor so so la cha bzhi gtso bo dang gtso bo ma yin pa'i ngo bos gnas te /
analyzed: bzhin du'o // 'di yang dkyil 'khor so so la cha bzhi gtso bo dang gtso bo ma yin pa'i ngo bos gnas te /
translated: Moreover, in each ma·πá·∏çala, there are four parts, which are the primary and secondary natures.

original: de rnams la yang de nyid kyi rim pas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams la yang de nyid kyi rim pas shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand them in the same order.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: me'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang gi cha shar pa na /
analyzed: me'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang gi cha shar pa na /
translated: When the fire ma·πá·∏çala arises in its own part,

original: g-yas pa'i g-yas pa las 'od zer dmar po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //üîΩme'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi cha shar ba na g-yas pa'i gyon pa las 'od zer ljang ser 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: g-yas pa'i g-yas pa las 'od zer dmar po 'byung bar 'gyur ro // me'i rlung gi dkyil 'khor gyi cha shar ba na g-yas pa'i gyon pa las 'od zer ljang ser 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: red light rays arise from the right side.üîΩWhen the fire wind ma·πá·∏çala arises in its own part, yellow-green light rays arise from the right side.

original: me'i sa'i cha 'char ba na g-yas pa'i gnyis ka las 'od zer ser po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me'i sa'i cha 'char ba na g-yas pa'i gnyis ka las 'od zer ser po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the fire earth ma·πá·∏çala arises in its own part, yellow light rays arise from both sides.

original: me chu'i cha 'char ba na g-yas pa'i gnyis ka las dal bar rgyu ba'i 'od zer dkar po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me chu'i cha 'char ba na g-yas pa'i gnyis ka las dal bar rgyu ba'i 'od zer dkar po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When the fire water ma·πá·∏çala arises in its own part, white light rays move slowly from both sides.

original: de bzhin du gzhan rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the others.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: nang gi dus ni yin par bshad //üîΩces gsungs te /
analyzed: nang gi dus ni yin par bshad //üîΩces gsungs te /
translated: The inner time is explained.

original: phyi rol du nyin zhag gcig la drug cu rtsa bzhi'i grangs ji lta ba bzhin du nyin zhag gcig la dbugs nyi khri chig stong drug brgya'i grangs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi rol du nyin zhag gcig la drug cu rtsa bzhi'i grangs ji lta ba bzhin du nyin zhag gcig la dbugs nyi khri chig stong drug brgya'i grangs su 'gyur ro //
translated: Externally, just as there are sixty-four [fingerbreadths] in one day and night, so there are twenty-one thousand six hundred breaths in one day and night.

original: ji ltar phyi rol du dbyu gu dang / thun gyi dbye bas nyi ma dang zla bas byas pa'i dus so //
analyzed: ji ltar phyi rol du dbyu gu dang / thun gyi dbye bas nyi ma dang zla bas byas pa'i dus so //
translated: Just as externally, time is made by the sun and moon through the divisions of ghatis and muhurtas,

original: de bzhin du nang gi bdag nyid can srog dang thur ser gyis byas pa'i dus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bzhin du nang gi bdag nyid can srog dang thur ser gyis byas pa'i dus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: so internally, time is made by the prƒÅ·πáa and ƒÅyƒÅma, that is the meaning.

original: de ltar rlung la 'jug pa'i lam brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar rlung la 'jug pa'i lam brjod nas /
translated: Having thus described the path of entry into the winds,

original: rlung gi bya ba rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rlung gi bya ba rgyas par bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach the function of the winds in detail,

original: de'i yan lag mdor bstan pa ni ;
analyzed: de'i yan lag mdor bstan pa ni ;
translated: the brief teaching of its branches is:

original: lkog ma snying ga lte ba dang // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: lkog ma snying ga lte ba dang // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The throat, heart, and navel

original: lkog ma'i chu skyes la me'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'od zer gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: lkog ma'i chu skyes la me'i dkyil 'khor gyi 'od zer gnas pa yin te /
translated: The light rays of the fire ma·πá·∏çala abide in the lotus of the throat.

original: de bzhin du chu dang rlung dang sa'i 'od zer rnams snying ga dang lte pa dang gsang ba'i chu skyes rnams la gnas zhes bya ba ni gnas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chu dang rlung dang sa'i 'od zer rnams snying ga dang lte pa dang gsang ba'i chu skyes rnams la gnas zhes bya ba ni gnas bstan pa'o //
translated: Likewise, the light rays of water, wind, and earth are located in the heart, navel, and secret lotus, respectively. This is the teaching of the locations.

original: de rnams kyang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba ston te byed pa'i khams rnams la don du ma nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyang 'gro ba dang 'ong ba ston te byed pa'i khams rnams la don du ma nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: And they are shown to go and come, because the elements have many meanings.

original: ston ces bya ba ni byed pa'i don to //
analyzed: ston ces bya ba ni byed pa'i don to //
translated: The word show has the meaning of do.

original: 'on 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang ldang ba'i bdag nyid can gyi rlung rnams ji ltar 'gro ba dang 'ong pa gnyis byed par rigs she na /
analyzed: 'on 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang ldang ba'i bdag nyid can gyi rlung rnams ji ltar 'gro ba dang 'ong pa gnyis byed par rigs she na /
translated: But how is it reasonable that the winds, which have the nature of entering, abiding, and rising, perform both going and coming?

original: 'di ni skyon med de 'gro ba dang mi 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dang zhes bya ba ni bar ma'i tshig mi snang bar byas nas /
analyzed: 'di ni skyon med de 'gro ba dang mi 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dang zhes bya ba ni bar ma'i tshig mi snang bar byas nas /
translated: This is faultless, because the word not is omitted in going and not going and coming.

original: sdud pa la gnyis ldan gyi bsdu ba bya'o //
analyzed: sdud pa la gnyis ldan gyi bsdu ba bya'o //
translated: The compound going and coming should be analyzed as a dvandva compound.

original: de rnams kyi phra ba dang rags pa'i dbye bas dus kyi nges pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de rnams kyi phra ba dang rags pa'i dbye bas dus kyi nges pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the divisions of subtle and coarse of those, and the determination of time,

original: gnas par zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gnas par zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, abiding, and so on.

original: 'dir dbyu gu drug cu rtsa bzhis ni phal cher nyin mtshan no //
analyzed: 'dir dbyu gu drug cu rtsa bzhis ni phal cher nyin mtshan no //
translated: Here, sixty-four breaths are almost a day and night.

original: de dang nyin @91b mtshan gyi dbye bas thun brgyad kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de dang nyin @91b mtshan gyi dbye bas thun brgyad kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: By dividing that into day and night, it is the nature of eight periods.

original: thun gyi tshad kyang dbyu gu brgyad kyi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: thun gyi tshad kyang dbyu gu brgyad kyi bdag nyid do //
translated: The measure of a period is the nature of eight breaths.

original: de'i phyir chu tshod phyed ni 'od gsal gya skad cig ma 'jug pa la sogs pa dang bral ba 'char ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir chu tshod phyed ni 'od gsal gya skad cig ma 'jug pa la sogs pa dang bral ba 'char ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, half a watch is the arising of the clear light in a moment free from the engagement of a hundred and sixty instants.

original: de yang cig car ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang cig car ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is not instantaneous.

original: 'on kyang chu tshod phyed dang brgyad la rgyu ba'i dbugs kyi 'khor lo la cha shas kyi dbye bas yud tsam mtshon par dka' ba'i skad cig la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang chu tshod phyed dang brgyad la rgyu ba'i dbugs kyi 'khor lo la cha shas kyi dbye bas yud tsam mtshon par dka' ba'i skad cig la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: However, it is engaged in an instant difficult to indicate by a muhurta due to the division of parts in the wheel of breath moving in half a watch and eight.

original: de yang phra mo'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis mtshon pa yin gyi ma dpyad pa'i nyams dga' bar rags pa'i blo dang ldan pa rnams kyi sa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang phra mo'i rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis mtshon pa yin gyi ma dpyad pa'i nyams dga' bar rags pa'i blo dang ldan pa rnams kyi sa ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, that is indicated by subtle yogis, not by those with coarse minds who delight in unexamined experience.

original: 'di ni re zhig rtse mo'i skad cig ma nye bar mtshon ba ni nyin mo chu tshod gnyis dang mtshan mo la yang gnyis zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig rtse mo'i skad cig ma nye bar mtshon ba ni nyin mo chu tshod gnyis dang mtshan mo la yang gnyis zhes bya'o //
translated: This is the illustration of the moment of the peak, which is said to be two hours in the day and two in the night.

original: de ltar na thun phyed kyi dus la chu tshod bzhi'i bdag nyid skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na thun phyed kyi dus la chu tshod bzhi'i bdag nyid skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, in half a watch, it arises in the form of four hours.

original: phra ba dang rags pa mthong bas dkyil 'khor bzhi 'char bas na so sor thun phyed kyi 'od zer gyi rgyu ba sna'i rtse mor gzung bar gyur pa na zhi ba la sogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: phra ba dang rags pa mthong bas dkyil 'khor bzhi 'char bas na so sor thun phyed kyi 'od zer gyi rgyu ba sna'i rtse mor gzung bar gyur pa na zhi ba la sogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur pa yin no //
translated: Since the four ma·πá·∏çalas arise by seeing the subtle and gross, the movement of the light rays in each half-watch is held at the tip of the nose, which is the cause of peace and so on.

original: rnal 'byor la rnams kyis kyang chu tshod bzhi'i bdag nyid can thun phyed kyis mtshon par byed pa dbugs kyi 'khor lo thams cad la de bzhin du dbye ba rigs par bya'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor la rnams kyis kyang chu tshod bzhi'i bdag nyid can thun phyed kyis mtshon par byed pa dbugs kyi 'khor lo thams cad la de bzhin du dbye ba rigs par bya'o //
translated: Also, the yogis should understand the divisions in the same way in all the cakras of the breath, which are illustrated by the half-watch of four hours.

original: gang gis thams cad 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin shes par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gis thams cad 'od gsal ba'i rang bzhin shes par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should know the nature of everything as clear light.

original: de nyid kyi phyir go rims ji bzhin zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir go rims ji bzhin zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúin order,‚Äù

original: g-yas pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas dkyil 'khor gyi rim pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: g-yas pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas dkyil 'khor gyi rim pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äúcircle of the mandala‚Äù is that it is divided into the right and so forth.

original: de ltar mdor bstan pa bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar mdor bstan pa bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the brief presentation,

original: rgyas par bshad pa brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyas par bshad pa brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to explain the extensive presentation,

original: g-yas pa nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: g-yas pa nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the BhagavƒÅn] declares, ‚Äúfrom the right,‚Äù and so forth.

original: sna bug g-yas pa nas thun dang po las byung ba'i 'od ces bya ba ni mnyam gnas kyis rlung gtso bo'o //
analyzed: sna bug g-yas pa nas thun dang po las byung ba'i 'od ces bya ba ni mnyam gnas kyis rlung gtso bo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe light that arises from the first period from the right nostril‚Äù is the primary wind of even placement.

original: me yi dkyil 'khor nyid yin te //üîΩzhes bya ba ni me'i dkyil 'khor las byung ba'i dbugs te /
analyzed: me yi dkyil 'khor nyid yin te // zhes bya ba ni me'i dkyil 'khor las byung ba'i dbugs te /
translated: It is the circle of fire itself.

original: rigs par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs par bya'o //
translated: The breath that arises from the circle of fire should be understood.

original: bsreg bya za bas snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: bsreg bya za bas snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The thought is that it consumes the fuel.

original: kha dog dmar zhing zhes bya ba ni rang dang 'os pa'i kha dog gi phyir snang ba mtha' yas kyi cha yis so //
analyzed: kha dog dmar zhing zhes bya ba ni rang dang 'os pa'i kha dog gi phyir snang ba mtha' yas kyi cha yis so //
translated: ‚ÄúRed in color‚Äù is because of the color of the appropriate self, and it is the portion of AmitƒÅbha.

original: gsal ba zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa la gsal par snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa la gsal par snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúClear‚Äù is because it appears clearly to the consciousness of the yogi.

original: padma mgon po zhes bya ba ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyis 'dod chags la sogs pa'i yul la padma ltar ma gos pa'i phyir padma ni snang ba mtha' yas @92a * //
analyzed: padma mgon po zhes bya ba ni so sor rtog pa'i ye shes kyis 'dod chags la sogs pa'i yul la padma ltar ma gos pa'i phyir padma ni snang ba mtha' yas @92a * //
translated: Lotus is Amitabha.

original: so ; / de nyid ni mgon po rang gi rigs rnams kyi bdag po nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: so ; / de nyid ni mgon po rang gi rigs rnams kyi bdag po nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: That itself is the Lord because of being the master of one's own family.

original: dor zhes bya ba ni rlung dang dkyil 'khor la'o //
analyzed: dor zhes bya ba ni rlung dang dkyil 'khor la'o //
translated: The word cast refers to the wind and the mandala.

original: lha ni byin gyis rlob par byed pa po'o //
analyzed: lha ni byin gyis rlob par byed pa po'o //
translated: The word god refers to the consecrator.

original: gyon pa nas ni 'byung zhes bya ba ni gyon pa'i sna bug nas thun gnyis pa la'o //
analyzed: gyon pa nas ni 'byung zhes bya ba ni gyon pa'i sna bug nas thun gnyis pa la'o //
translated: The word emerge refers to the second period, emerging from the nose-tip where it was cast.

original: 'byung ba'i 'od ces bya ba ni rlung gyen du rgyu ba'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i 'od ces bya ba ni rlung gyen du rgyu ba'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The word light refers to the nature of the upward-moving wind.

original: rlung gi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba ni de las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rlung gi dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba ni de las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word mandala refers to the wind mandala because it arises from that.

original: ljang ser dag tu snang ba ste //
analyzed: ljang ser dag tu snang ba ste //
translated: It appears as green and yellow.

original: zhes bya ba ni don yod grub pa'i mdog gi phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni don yod grub pa'i mdog gi phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is the color of Amoghasiddhi.

original: las kyi mgon po zhes bya ba ni bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo rnam par dag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: las kyi mgon po zhes bya ba ni bya ba grub pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo rnam par dag pa'i phyir /
translated: The so-called Karma-natha is Amoghasiddhi, because he is the essence of the wisdom of successful action.

original: las ni don yod grub pa'o //
analyzed: las ni don yod grub pa'o //
translated: Karma is Amoghasiddhi.

original: de nyid kyang mgon po ste ;
analyzed: de nyid kyang mgon po ste ;
translated: He is also the natha,

original: de'i rigs rnams la bdag po nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rigs rnams la bdag po nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because he is the lord of those of his family.

original: der zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor 'di dang / rlung la'o //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor 'di dang / rlung la'o //
translated: There means in this mandala and in the wind.

original: lha zhes bya ba ni sngar bzhin no //
analyzed: lha zhes bya ba ni sngar bzhin no //
translated: The god is as before.

original: gnyis ka las ni zhes bya ba ni sna'i bug dag las 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnyis ka las ni zhes bya ba ni sna'i bug dag las 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: From both means from both nostrils.

original: phyir 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: phyir 'byung ba'o //
translated: Arising means coming out.

original: 'od ces bya ba ni thur sel gyi rlung gi ngo bo'o //
analyzed: 'od ces bya ba ni thur sel gyi rlung gi ngo bo'o //
translated: Light means the essence of the wind of downward voiding.

original: mdog ser po zhes bya ba ni rin chen 'byur ldan gyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mdog ser po zhes bya ba ni rin chen 'byur ldan gyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Yellow color means the essence of Ratnasa·πÉbhava.

original: 'od chen po zhes bya ba ni 'od gsal gyi ngo bo nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'od chen po zhes bya ba ni 'od gsal gyi ngo bo nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Great light means the appearance of the essence of clear light.

original: dbang chen gyi ni dkyil 'khor nyid //
analyzed: dbang chen gyi ni dkyil 'khor nyid //
translated: The mandala of great power

original: ces bya ba ni sa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni sa'i dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: means the mandala of earth.

original: rin chen mgon po zhes bya ba ni bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa nyid kyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir rin chen 'byung ldan no //
analyzed: rin chen mgon po zhes bya ba ni bsam pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed pa nyid kyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir rin chen 'byung ldan no //
translated: The one called Ratnapala is Ratnasambhava, because he is the essence of the perfection of generosity, by virtue of fulfilling all wishes.

original: de nyid kyang rin po che'i rigs can rnams la bdag po nyid kyi phyir mgon po'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyang rin po che'i rigs can rnams la bdag po nyid kyi phyir mgon po'o //
translated: He is also the protector, because he is the lord of those of the jewel lineage.

original: der zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor dang rlung ngo //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor dang rlung ngo //
translated: There means the mandala and the wind.

original: lha zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lha zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The god is as before.

original: dal zhing rgyu ba zhes bya ba ni chu'i dkyil 'khor gyi ngo bo nyid kyis 'og tu 'gro ba'i ngang tshul can gyi phyir dal ba ste /
analyzed: dal zhing rgyu ba zhes bya ba ni chu'i dkyil 'khor gyi ngo bo nyid kyis 'og tu 'gro ba'i ngang tshul can gyi phyir dal ba ste /
translated: Slow-moving means slow, because of the nature of the water mandala, which has the tendency to move downward.

original: rgyun ma chad par rgyu bas dal ba'i phyir dal bar rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: rgyun ma chad par rgyu bas dal ba'i phyir dal bar rgyu ba'o //
translated: It is slow-moving because it moves slowly, without interruption.

original: kun du zla ba dkar dang mtshungs //
analyzed: kun du zla ba dkar dang mtshungs //
translated: All around, it is like the white moon

original: zhes bya ba ni chu nyid dkar ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chu nyid dkar ba'i phyir ro //
translated: means that the water itself is white.

original: chu yi dkyil 'khor nyid yin te //
analyzed: chu yi dkyil 'khor nyid yin te //
translated: It is the water mandala.

original: zhes bya ba ni thun bzhi pa la de nas srog gi rlung 'jug pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thun bzhi pa la de nas srog gi rlung 'jug pas so //
translated: This is because the life-force wind enters in the fourth period.

original: rdo rje mgon po zhes bya ba ni rdo rje ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi phyir mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje mgon po zhes bya ba ni rdo rje ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i chos kyi dbyings kyi phyir mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The vajra lord is Akshobhya, because he is the vajra of the extremely pure realm of phenomena.

original: de nyid kyis rang gi zigs rnams kyi bdag po nyid kyi phyir mgon po'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyis rang gi zigs rnams kyi bdag po nyid kyi phyir mgon po'o //
translated: He is the lord because he is the master of his own vision.

original: der zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor dang rlung dag go //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor dang rlung dag go //
translated: There means in the mandala and in the winds.

original: lha zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lha zhes bya ba ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The deity is as before.

original: rlung lnga pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rlung lnga pa'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the nature of the fifth wind,

original: lus kun la gnas pa'i rlung zhes bya ba ni gang zhig lnga pa'i @92b rlung ni khyab byed kyi rlung ste /
analyzed: lus kun la gnas pa'i rlung zhes bya ba ni gang zhig lnga pa'i @92b rlung ni khyab byed kyi rlung ste /
translated: the wind that pervades the entire body is the pervading wind.

original: 'chi ba'i lus la 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i lus la 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: It arises in the body at death.

original: zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
translated: This is the connection.

original: lus kun gyi ni zhes bya ba ni lus kyi phra ba'i rgyus pa'i tshogs la rjes su 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: lus kun gyi ni zhes bya ba ni lus kyi phra ba'i rgyus pa'i tshogs la rjes su 'gro ba ste /
translated: The entire body means that it pervades the entire body, the collection of subtle channels.

original: khyab byed nyid du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: khyab byed nyid du gnas pa'o //
translated: It abides as the pervader.

original: bya ba kun la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni rlung rnams thams cad la 'jug pa la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: bya ba kun la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni rlung rnams thams cad la 'jug pa la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: Engaging in all activities means engaging in all the winds and so forth.

original: de rnams la 'jug par byed pa ni 'jug pa'i rten du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams la 'jug par byed pa ni 'jug pa'i rten du gyur pa'o //
translated: Engaging in them is the support for engaging in them.

original: gang gi phyir rten med par brten pa la gnas pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba 'jug pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rten med par brten pa la gnas pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba 'jug pa ma yin te /
translated: Because without a support, the divisions of abiding and so forth do not engage.

original: snod kyi 'jig rten med par bcud kyi sems can ltar snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: snod kyi 'jig rten med par bcud kyi sems can ltar snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: It is like the absence of the world of the environment without the world of the inhabitants.

original: yang na bya ba kun ni spyod lam gyis gnas pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo ste /üîΩde rnams la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: yang na bya ba kun ni spyod lam gyis gnas pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo ste / de rnams la 'jug pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, all activities are the nature of the postures and so forth.

original: rnam par snang mdzad ngo bo ste //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad ngo bo ste //
translated: Engaging in them is the support for engaging in them.üîΩVairochana is the essence.

original: zhes bya ba ni khyad par du me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyi phyir gsal bar byed pas na rnam par snang mdzad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khyad par du me long lta bu'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid kyi phyir gsal bar byed pas na rnam par snang mdzad do //
translated: Since it is the essence of the mirror-like exalted wisdom in particular, it is illuminating.

original: de'i ngo bo ni sa'i khams kyi rnam par dag pa dang / gzugs kyi phung po rnam par dag pas so //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni sa'i khams kyi rnam par dag pa dang / gzugs kyi phung po rnam par dag pas so //
translated: Its essence is the purity of the earth element and the purity of the form aggregate.

original: de la rtag tu bya ba med pa la 'chi ba'i lus las 'byung ba nyid las te /
analyzed: de la rtag tu bya ba med pa la 'chi ba'i lus las 'byung ba nyid las te /
translated: In that, the absence of constant activity is due to the arising from the body at death.

original: rnam par shes pa rlung la zhon pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rlung la zhon pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: That is because consciousness itself rides on the wind.

original: de ltar rgyas par bshad pa bstan nas nye bar bsdu ba'i sgo nas rlung gi de kho na nyid zab mo bstan pa ni rlung gi de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar rgyas par bshad pa bstan nas nye bar bsdu ba'i sgo nas rlung gi de kho na nyid zab mo bstan pa ni rlung gi de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Having taught that in detail, the profound reality of the wind is taught by way of summary, stating ‚Äúthe reality of the wind,‚Äù and so on.

original: de ma thag par bshad pa rnams so //
analyzed: de ma thag par bshad pa rnams so //
translated: Those just explained.

original: gsal ba zhes bya ba ni bsgom bzhin pa la rim gyis gsal bar 'gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba zhes bya ba ni bsgom bzhin pa la rim gyis gsal bar 'gyur pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúClear‚Äù means that while meditating, they gradually become clear.

original: ye shes lnga yi rang bzhin can //
analyzed: ye shes lnga yi rang bzhin can //
translated: Having the nature of the five pristine consciousnesses

original: zhes bya ba ni rlung lnga po rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid can gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rlung lnga po rnams ni de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid can gyi phyir ro //
translated: means that the five winds have the nature of the five tathagatas.

original: rtog ge zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i lta ba dang ldan pa rtog ge skam po tsam la dga' ba dag gis mi rtogs zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rtog ge zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i lta ba dang ldan pa rtog ge skam po tsam la dga' ba dag gis mi rtogs zhes pa'i don to //
translated: ‚Äú Logic‚Äù means that those who delight in mere dry logic, who have a view with reference points, do not realize.

original: byis pa'i yul min zhing zhes bya ba ni byis pa ni de kho na nyid la brda ma byang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: byis pa'i yul min zhing zhes bya ba ni byis pa ni de kho na nyid la brda ma byang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúNot the domain of the childish‚Äù means that the childish are not skilled in the reality of the winds.

original: rnal 'byor yang yin te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor yang yin te /
translated: They are ‚Äúyogis‚Äù

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du byed pa la sogs pa la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon du byed pa la sogs pa la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they abide in the realization of the fruit of stream-entry, and so on.

original: byis pa yang yin la rnal 'byor yang yin pas na de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: byis pa yang yin la rnal 'byor yang yin pas na de skad ces bya'o //
translated: They are called ‚Äúchildish yogis‚Äù because they are both childish and yogis.

original: de rnams las de nyan thos rnams dang bskyed pa'i rim pa la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams las de nyan thos rnams dang bskyed pa'i rim pa la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Among them, the childish yogis are the ≈õrƒÅvakas and those abiding in the stage of creation.

original: yul min cing zhes bya ba ni spyod yul du ma gyur pa ste /üîΩde ltar rnam pa drug @93a * //
analyzed: yul min cing zhes bya ba ni spyod yul du ma gyur pa ste / de ltar rnam pa drug @93a * //
translated: ‚ÄúNot the domain‚Äù means not the sphere.

original: gis rlung gi de kho na nyid rgyas par bshad pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gis rlung gi de kho na nyid rgyas par bshad pa gsungs so //
translated: Thus, the reality of the winds is explained in six topics.

original: de ltar don rnam pa lngas rlung gi de kho na nyid rgyas par bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar don rnam pa lngas rlung gi de kho na nyid rgyas par bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the reality of the winds in five topics,

original: de'i che ba'i bdag nyid brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i che ba'i bdag nyid brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to express its greatness,

original: dngos grub thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dngos grub thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, ‚Äúall powers,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub kyi byed pa po nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dngos grub kyi byed pa po nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the agent of both mundane and supramundane powers.

original: de la 'jig rten pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dngos grub bo //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa ni zhi ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi dngos grub bo //
translated: Among them, the mundane is the power characterized by pacification, etc.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: ya yig don gyis gang cung zad //
analyzed: ya yig don gyis gang cung zad //
translated: Whatever is the meaning of the syllable ya,

original: dngos grub 'dod pas thams cad bya //
analyzed: dngos grub 'dod pas thams cad bya //
translated: all of that is to be done by one who desires power.

original: ra yig la sogs gsum nyid kyis //üîΩ'gro ba'i don la 'jug par bya //
analyzed: ra yig la sogs gsum nyid kyis // 'gro ba'i don la 'jug par bya //
translated: By the three, the syllable ra, etc.,

original: zhes gsungs so ;
analyzed: zhes gsungs so ;
translated: one should engage in the welfare of the world.

original: /'jig rten las 'das pa ni ngag rnam par dben pa'i mtshan nyid can te /
analyzed: /'jig rten las 'das pa ni ngag rnam par dben pa'i mtshan nyid can te /
translated: The supramundane is characterized by the isolation of speech.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: sngags kyi de nyid gsal ba ni //
analyzed: sngags kyi de nyid gsal ba ni //
translated: The clarity of the reality of mantra

original: ye shes gsum gyis rab dbye bas //
analyzed: ye shes gsum gyis rab dbye bas //
translated: is well differentiated by the three intuitions.

original: sems tsam la ni nges par sbyar //
analyzed: sems tsam la ni nges par sbyar //
translated: It is definitely applied to mind only.

original: gsal bar byed ces bya ba ni //
analyzed: gsal bar byed ces bya ba ni //
translated: The term ‚Äúclarity‚Äù

original: rnal 'byor pa ye shes pa la //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa ye shes pa la //
translated: is because the intuition of the yogi

original: shin tu gsal ba nyid kyi phyir ro ;üîΩ/ rnal 'byor kun gyi don sgrub pa //
analyzed: shin tu gsal ba nyid kyi phyir ro ; / rnal 'byor kun gyi don sgrub pa //
translated: is very clear.üîΩThe accomplishment of the aim of all yogas

original: zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor kun gyi ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor kun gyi ni /
translated: is because of the accomplishment of the aim of all yogas.

original: rlung thams cad kyi sbyor bas don ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rlung thams cad kyi sbyor bas don ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The meaning of all the wind yogas is the nature of vajra repetition.

original: sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa'i don thams cad sgrub par byed pas na /
analyzed: sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor pa'i don thams cad sgrub par byed pas na /
translated: The meaning of accomplishment is that it accomplishes all the goals of the yogin.

original: rnal 'byor kun gyi don sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor kun gyi don sgrub pa'o //
translated: It accomplishes the goals of all yogas.

original: yang dag de nyid go 'phang zhes bya ba ni ma ning gi bzlas pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag de nyid go 'phang zhes bya ba ni ma ning gi bzlas pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of the state of perfect reality is because of the nature of the neuter repetition.

original: gsal zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi de kho na nyid kyi sbyor bas gsal bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩrgyud rnams kun gyi don sdud pa //
analyzed: gsal zhes bya ba ni sngags kyi de kho na nyid kyi sbyor bas gsal bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro // rgyud rnams kun gyi don sdud pa //
translated: The meaning of clear is because of the clarity of the mantra reality yoga.

original: zhes bya ba ni rgyud rnams thams cad kyi don ni thig le'i sbyor ba la sogs pa ste /üîΩde'i sdud pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgyud rnams thams cad kyi don ni thig le'i sbyor ba la sogs pa ste / de'i sdud pa ni /
translated: The meaning of the collection of the meanings of all tantras is the yoga of the bindu, and so on, of all the tantras.

original: rgyud thams cad kyi don sdud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyud thams cad kyi don sdud par byed pa'o //
translated: The meaning of its collection is that it collects the meanings of all the tantras.

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i go 'phang zhes bya ba ni ngag gi 'od gsal ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i go 'phang zhes bya ba ni ngag gi 'od gsal ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of the state of Vajrasattva is because of the luminosity of speech.

original: gsal zhes bya ba ni thabs las byung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal zhes bya ba ni thabs las byung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of clear is because of the arising from the method.

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni dus gsum mo //
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni dus gsum mo //
translated: ‚ÄúAlways‚Äù means in the three times.

original: thams cad bdag nyid ces bya ba ni lus thams cad dang yul la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad bdag nyid ces bya ba ni lus thams cad dang yul la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAll‚Äù means the whole body and the objects, etc.

original: bzhugs zhes bya ba ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bzhugs zhes bya ba ni bskyed pa'i rim pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúAbides‚Äù means being free from the characteristics of the creation stage.

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù means non-erroneously.

original: shin tu phra zhes bya ba ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu phra zhes bya ba ni rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pa'i rnal 'byor pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúVery subtle‚Äù means being a yogin who abides in the completion stage.

original: rtogs par bya zhes bya ba ni shes par bya zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rtogs par bya zhes bya ba ni shes par bya zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúShould be realized‚Äù means ‚Äúshould be known.‚Äù

original: bla ma'i @93b zhal las zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid phun sum tshogs pa'i bla ma'i zhal las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bla ma'i @93b zhal las zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid phun sum tshogs pa'i bla ma'i zhal las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the guru‚Äôs mouth‚Äù means from the mouth of a guru who is endowed with the characteristics.

original: rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud dpal rdo rje phreng ba'i rgya cher 'grel pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud dpal rdo rje phreng ba'i rgya cher 'grel pa /
translated: The commentary on the glorious Vajra Garland, a great yoga tantra,üîΩis completed.

original: pandi ta aa langka ka la shas mdzad pa zab mo'i don shin tu gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba las le'u bcu gnyis ba'i rgya cher bshad pa'o /üîΩ// / de ltar le'u bcu gnyis pas rlung gi de kho na nyid kyi yul la dri ba'i lan bstan nas /üîΩda ni skabs su bab pa'i bde ba chen po'i yul la dri ba'i lan gdab pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pandi ta aa langka ka la shas mdzad pa zab mo'i don shin tu gsal bar byed pa zhes bya ba las le'u bcu gnyis ba'i rgya cher bshad pa'o / // / de ltar le'u bcu gnyis pas rlung gi de kho na nyid kyi yul la dri ba'i lan bstan nas / da ni skabs su bab pa'i bde ba chen po'i yul la dri ba'i lan gdab pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: This is the commentary on the twelfth chapter of the commentary called ‚ÄúIlluminating the Meaning of the Words, ‚Äù composed by the pa·πá·∏çita Ala·πÖkƒÅrapƒÅda.üîΩüîΩThus, having explained the reply to the question about the domain of the reality of the vƒÅyu in the twelfth chapter,üîΩnow, in order to explain the reply to the question about the domain of great bliss,üîΩüîΩ

original: le'u bcu gsum pa ston cing rtsom pa ni /üîΩde nas gzhan rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /üîΩle'u bcu gnyis pa'i rjes la'o //üîΩgzhan rnams zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi la ltos nas dbye ba'o //üîΩnyon zhes bya ba ni phyag na rdo rje thos pa la sbyar ba'o //üîΩbde ba chen po'i go 'phang bshad par bya ba dang 'brel to //üîΩ'chad par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: le'u bcu gsum pa ston cing rtsom pa ni /üîΩde nas gzhan rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /üîΩle'u bcu gnyis pa'i rjes la'o //üîΩgzhan rnams zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi la ltos nas dbye ba'o //üîΩnyon zhes bya ba ni phyag na rdo rje thos pa la sbyar ba'o //üîΩbde ba chen po'i go 'phang bshad par bya ba dang 'brel to //üîΩ'chad par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid brjod par bya'o //
translated: This is the commentary on the twelfth chapter of the treatise called ‚ÄúThe Ornament of the Essence,‚Äù the section on the object of the suchness of vƒÅyu.

original: gsal zhes bya ba ni gcig tu ltos pa med par rtogs pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal zhes bya ba ni gcig tu ltos pa med par rtogs pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúClear‚Äù means that it is realized as not depending on anything else.

original: de ltar bde ba chen po'i yul la dri ba'i rtsom pa'i lan bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar bde ba chen po'i yul la dri ba'i rtsom pa'i lan bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the answer to the question about the object of great bliss,

original: dngos grub bde ba chen po brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos grub bde ba chen po brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to express the great bliss of power,

original: de'i yan lag mdor bstan pa gnyis ka'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i yan lag mdor bstan pa gnyis ka'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: he teaches the answer to the question about the cause of great bliss, following the Tantra of the Two Examinations.

original: rdor sems go 'phang mi byed pa //
analyzed: rdor sems go 'phang mi byed pa //
translated: Not making the state of Vajrasattva

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: and so on.

original: ye shes lnga'i ngo bo rtsa lnga'i rang bzhin can gyi rdo rje ste /
analyzed: ye shes lnga'i ngo bo rtsa lnga'i rang bzhin can gyi rdo rje ste /
translated: Vajra is the nature of the five channels, which are the essence of the five intuitions.

original: de la sems ni kun rdzob byang chub sems 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid rdo rje sems dpa' de'i ngo bo'i tshig ni sgra'am gnas te /
analyzed: de la sems ni kun rdzob byang chub sems 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid rdo rje sems dpa' de'i ngo bo'i tshig ni sgra'am gnas te /
translated: The mind is the nature of Vajrasattva, which is the retention of the relative spirit of enlightenment. The word ‚Äústate‚Äù is the sound or place of that essence.

original: dbye ba tha dad pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //üîΩrang rig pas na zhes bya ba ni rang gi rig par bya bas na rang rig pa ste /
analyzed: dbye ba tha dad pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro // rang rig pas na zhes bya ba ni rang gi rig par bya bas na rang rig pa ste /
translated: It is free from the differentiation of divisions.

original: gzhan rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBy self-awareness‚Äù means that it is to be known by itself, because it is not the domain of others.

original: mchog gi mchog ces bya ba ni nyams su myong ba gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog gi mchog ces bya ba ni nyams su myong ba gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The supreme of the supreme is so called because of the clarity of the experience.

original: de'i phyir mchog ces bya ba ni de las 'das pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir mchog ces bya ba ni de las 'das pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the supreme is so called because of the transcendence of that.

original: yang na rtog pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir mchog go //
analyzed: yang na rtog pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir mchog go //
translated: Or, it is supreme because it abandons all conceptualization.

original: de las kyang mchog ni de kho na nyid gcig ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis bde ba chen po'i ngo bo'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las kyang mchog ni de kho na nyid gcig ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis bde ba chen po'i ngo bo'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is supreme because of that, since it is the nature of great bliss by the nature of the identity of the one reality.

original: kun rtog kyi  rtags kyis stong pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po dang dngos po min pa dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rnam rtog la sogs pa las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rtog kyi  rtags kyis stong pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po dang dngos po min pa dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rnam rtog la sogs pa las 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is empty of the signs of conceptualization, because it transcends the conceptualization of entity and non-entity, pleasure and pain, and so forth.

original: bde ba chen po zhes 'di brjod //
analyzed: bde ba chen po zhes 'di brjod //
translated: It is called great bliss.

original: ces bya ba ni rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud 'di @94a * //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rnal 'byor chen po'i rgyud 'di @94a * //
translated: This is what is said in this Tantra of Great Yoga.

original: nyid du bde ba chen po zhes bya ba 'di lta bu la brjod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyid du bde ba chen po zhes bya ba 'di lta bu la brjod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúIt is called great bliss.‚Äù

original: da ltar gnyis ka'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas mdor ba stan pa brjod nas /
analyzed: da ltar gnyis ka'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas mdor ba stan pa brjod nas /
translated: Now, following the tantras of both, the brief teaching is stated.

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas /
translated: Following the uncommon tantras,

original: mdor bstan pa brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mdor bstan pa brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to express the brief explanation,

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i dus ni zhes bya ba gsungs te /üîΩsnyigs ma lnga'i rnyog pa can du byas pa'i rtsod pa'i dus la 'byed par byed pa nyid kyis rgyu dang rkyen las ma skyes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i dus ni zhes bya ba gsungs te / snyigs ma lnga'i rnyog pa can du byas pa'i rtsod pa'i dus la 'byed par byed pa nyid kyis rgyu dang rkyen las ma skyes pa'i phyir /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe time of the connate‚ÄùüîΩand so on.üîΩSince the time of the connate is not produced from causes and conditions,üîΩit is the inconceivable essence that is divided into the time of the dispute,

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i dus ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i dus ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: which is made turbid by the five degenerations.

original: des bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa'i tshig gis bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: des bya ba ni rdo rje sems dpa'i tshig gis bstan par bya'o //
translated: That is to be explained by the words of Vajrasattva.

original: gzung dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs //
analyzed: gzung dang 'dzin pa rnam par spangs //
translated: ‚ÄúFree from apprehendeds and apprehenders‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni yul dang dbang po rnam par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yul dang dbang po rnam par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: means that the objects and the sense organs are abandoned.

original: bde dang sdug bsngal rnam par spangs //
analyzed: bde dang sdug bsngal rnam par spangs //
translated: ‚ÄúFree from pleasure and pain‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni sems nye bar zhi ba'i rnam par lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi bde ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems nye bar zhi ba'i rnam par lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi bde ba'o //
translated: means that pleasure is the characteristic of nirvƒÅ·πáa without remainder, the pacification of the mind.

original: sdug bsngal ni phung po lnga'i bdag nyid can 'khor ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni phung po lnga'i bdag nyid can 'khor ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Suffering is the characteristic of samsara, which has the nature of the five aggregates.

original: de dag las rnam par grol ba ni bral ba'o //
analyzed: de dag las rnam par grol ba ni bral ba'o //
translated: Liberation from them is separation.

original: zhi ba gnyis med rnam par 'byed //
analyzed: zhi ba gnyis med rnam par 'byed //
translated: Peace, nonduality, and distinction

original: ces bya ba ni nyan thos kyi ye shes dga' ba gnyis kyi bdag nyid can zhi ba dang / gnyis su med pa dang rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes dga' bral gyi mtshan nyid can khyad par 'byed pas zhi ba gnyis med rnam par bral ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni nyan thos kyi ye shes dga' ba gnyis kyi bdag nyid can zhi ba dang / gnyis su med pa dang rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes dga' bral gyi mtshan nyid can khyad par 'byed pas zhi ba gnyis med rnam par bral ba'o //
translated: The wisdom of the sravakas has the nature of two joys, peace, and nonduality. The wisdom of the pratyekabuddhas has the characteristic of the joy of separation.

original: dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin bdag //
analyzed: dngos po kun gyi rang bzhin bdag //
translated: The nature of all things is the self.

original: ces bya ba ni kun gyi sgras ni bde ba'i rtsal brjod do /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni kun gyi sgras ni bde ba'i rtsal brjod do /
translated: The word all refers to the expression of the power of bliss.

original: dngos po ni ye shes chen po'i ngo bo byang chub kyi sems yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po ni ye shes chen po'i ngo bo byang chub kyi sems yod pa nyid do //
translated: Things are the existence of the bodhicitta that is the essence of great wisdom.

original: de ltar na rtsa rnams thams cad la byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo'i ye shes dngos po kun no //
analyzed: de ltar na rtsa rnams thams cad la byang chub kyi sems kyi ngo bo'i ye shes dngos po kun no //
translated: Thus, the wisdom that has the nature of bodhicitta is all things in all the nadis.

original: de'i rang bzhin ni de'i rang bzhin te ;
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni de'i rang bzhin te ;
translated: Its nature is the nature of that.

original: de la bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúnature of great bliss‚Äù is that.

original: bde chen zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal thams cad nye bar zhi bar byed pa'o /
analyzed: bde chen zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal thams cad nye bar zhi bar byed pa'o /
translated: ‚Äú Great bliss‚Äù is the pacification of all suffering.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni skabs 'di la'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni skabs 'di la'o //
translated: ‚Äú Here‚Äù means in this context.

original: brjod ces bya ba ni brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: brjod ces bya ba ni brjod par bya ba'o //

original: de ltar rnam pa gnyis kyis mdor bstan pa bshang nas /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gnyis kyis mdor bstan pa bshang nas /

analyzed: rgyas par bshad pa'i yan lag thun mong ba'i rgyud kyi rjes su 'brangs nas brjod pa'i phyir /

analyzed: de'i rdo rje'i tshig rgyas par bshad pa ni /

analyzed: ye shes lnga'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the five families, the five pristine consciousnesses,üîΩthe five buddha bodies, and the five great bliss.

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i rnam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: rdo rje zhes bya ba ni don dam par stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid dang / kun rdzob tu @94b sha lnga'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes bya ba ni don dam par stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid dang / kun rdzob tu @94b sha lnga'i bdag nyid can no //

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / sangs rgyas lnga bdag rang bzhin can //

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rnam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

translated: The channels are five, the flow is downward.üîΩüîΩ

analyzed: stong snyid rdo rje go 'phang zhes bya ba ni 'di ni ye shes lnga'i bdag nyid can gyi de ma thag par gsungs pa ni /

original: rgyas par bshad pa mdzad de /
analyzed: rgyas par bshad pa mdzad de /
translated: The passage beginning with ‚Äúthe

original: rtag tu de lta nyid du rnam par rtog pa thams cad 'joms par byed cing ma bcos pas na gnas pa nyid kyi phyir rdo rje go 'phang ngo //
analyzed: rtag tu de lta nyid du rnam par rtog pa thams cad 'joms par byed cing ma bcos pas na gnas pa nyid kyi phyir rdo rje go 'phang ngo //
translated: It is the vajra-stage because it is always just that, and because it is the abode that destroys all discursive thought and is unfabricated.

original: gsal zhes bya ba ni bsgom bzhin pa'i rab kyi mthar thug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal zhes bya ba ni bsgom bzhin pa'i rab kyi mthar thug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúClear‚Äù means that it is the culmination of the meditation.

original: rang bzhin med cing zhes bya ba ni phung po khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzlog pas so //
analyzed: rang bzhin med cing zhes bya ba ni phung po khams dang skye mched la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzlog pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout intrinsic nature‚Äù means that it is the reversal of the discursive thought of the aggregates, elements, sense-fields, and so on.

original: rnam pa med pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs can ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa med pa zhes bya ba ni gzugs can ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout aspects‚Äù means that it is not material.

original: gnyis su med pa dang zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis dang rnam par bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis su med pa dang zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis dang rnam par bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúNon-dual‚Äù means that it is free from the duality of the apprehended object and the apprehending subject.

original: tha dad spangs zhes bya ba ni bskyed pa'i rim pa bsgoms pas bsgom bya dang sgom byed kyi rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad spangs zhes bya ba ni bskyed pa'i rim pa bsgoms pas bsgom bya dang sgom byed kyi rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúFree from differentiation‚Äù means that it is free from the discursive thought of the meditator and the object of meditation due to the meditation on the creation stage.

original: cha med ces bya ba ni sa bon gyi yi ge yongs su gyur pa las dben pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: cha med ces bya ba ni sa bon gyi yi ge yongs su gyur pa las dben pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: The partless is because of the isolation of the seed syllable, which is transformed.

original: / cha ni rnam par 'das zhes bya ba ni nyi ma dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩkun du rtog pa thams cad 'joms //
analyzed: / cha ni rnam par 'das zhes bya ba ni nyi ma dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir ro // kun du rtog pa thams cad 'joms //
translated: The partless is because of the freedom from the conception of the disks of the sun and moon.

original: zhes bya ba ni zhal gsum phyag drug pa'i rnam pa can bsgoms pas tha mal pa dang de ma yin pa thams cad kyi rnam par rtog pa 'joms pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni zhal gsum phyag drug pa'i rnam pa can bsgoms pas tha mal pa dang de ma yin pa thams cad kyi rnam par rtog pa 'joms pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It destroys all conceptual thoughts because of the destruction of all ordinary and non-ordinary conceptual thoughts by the meditation on the form of the three faces and six arms.

original: skye med ces bya ba ni rigs brgya'i dbye bas bsgom pa las 'das pa nyid kyi skye ba bzlog pas so //
analyzed: skye med ces bya ba ni rigs brgya'i dbye bas bsgom pa las 'das pa nyid kyi skye ba bzlog pas so //
translated: The unborn is because of the reversal of birth by the transcendence of meditation by the division of the hundred families.

original: zad med ces bya ba ni dbugs kyi 'khor lo nyin mtshan du 'jug pas zad pa med ba'o //
analyzed: zad med ces bya ba ni dbugs kyi 'khor lo nyin mtshan du 'jug pas zad pa med ba'o //
translated: The inexhaustible is because of the inexhaustibility by the entry of the wheel of breath day and night.

original: zhi ba dang zhes bya ba ni ngag gi spros pa bzhi rnam par zhi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi ba dang zhes bya ba ni ngag gi spros pa bzhi rnam par zhi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The peaceful is because of the pacification of the four elaborations of speech.

original: gnyis med ces bya ba ni @95a * //
analyzed: gnyis med ces bya ba ni @95a * //
translated: The non-dual is because of the non-duality of the object of knowledge and the subject of knowledge.

original: rang bzhin dang snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang 'od gsal ba la spang bya dang mngon du bya ba gnyis las log pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin dang snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang 'od gsal ba la spang bya dang mngon du bya ba gnyis las log pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the reversal of the two, the object of elimination and the object of manifestation, in regard to the nature, the aspect of appearance, and clear light.

original: bde ba thams cad ces bya ba ni phyag rgya'i rim pas thob par bya ba nyid kyi phyir bde ba chen po ma lus pa thams cad gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩnyon mongs kun las rnam grol ba //
analyzed: bde ba thams cad ces bya ba ni phyag rgya'i rim pas thob par bya ba nyid kyi phyir bde ba chen po ma lus pa thams cad gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro // nyon mongs kun las rnam grol ba //
translated: All bliss is because of the illumination of all of the entirety of great bliss, because of the attainment by means of the stage of the seal.

original: zhes bya ba ni sems kyi 'od gsal ba thob pa'i rjes la sgyu ma'i rang bzhin gyis lus phung po'i rnam par rtog pa las log pa'i phyir dang / bden pa'i rnam par rtog pa log pa'o //üîΩbde ba thams cad la 'jug pa //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems kyi 'od gsal ba thob pa'i rjes la sgyu ma'i rang bzhin gyis lus phung po'i rnam par rtog pa las log pa'i phyir dang / bden pa'i rnam par rtog pa log pa'o // bde ba thams cad la 'jug pa //
translated: Liberated from all afflictions is because of the reversal of the conceptualization of the aggregates in the form of the body by means of the nature of illusion, after the attainment of the clear light of mind, and because of the reversal of the conceptualization of truth.

original: zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i rgyu phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi mngon par byang chub pa'i rim gyis nye bar thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i rgyu phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can gyi mngon par byang chub pa'i rim gyis nye bar thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Engaging all bliss is because of the attainment by means of the stage of manifest enlightenment, which has the nature of the external and internal cause of the clear light by nature.

original: stong dang zhes bya ba ni bag chags su gyur pa sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi chags bral gyi rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: stong dang zhes bya ba ni bag chags su gyur pa sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi chags bral gyi rang bzhin gyis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúEmpty‚Äù means empty of the nature of detachment from the thirty-two latent impulses.

original: shin tu stong pa zhes bya ba ni sngar bzhin rang bzhin gyi tshogs bzhi bcu spangs pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu stong pa zhes bya ba ni sngar bzhin rang bzhin gyi tshogs bzhi bcu spangs pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTotally empty‚Äù means, as before, the identity of the abandonment of the forty natural instincts.

original: stong pa chen po dang zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi tshogs bdun spangs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa chen po dang zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi tshogs bdun spangs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúGreat emptiness‚Äù means the abandonment of the seven natural instincts.

original: mchog gi zhes bya ba ni sems kyi 'od gsal las mchog ste /
analyzed: mchog gi zhes bya ba ni sems kyi 'od gsal las mchog ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSupreme‚Äù means supreme from the clear light of the mind.

original: mchog tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu gyur pa'o //
translated: It is supreme,

original: thams cad stong pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad stong pa zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAll empty‚Äù means the aspect of natural luminosity.

original: stong pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni zung 'jug gi bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: stong pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni zung 'jug gi bdag nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúPlace of emptiness‚Äù means the identity of union.

original: nam mkha' lnga'i ngo bo nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' lnga'i ngo bo nyid kyi zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga stong pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe nature of the five spaces‚Äù means the nature of the emptiness of the five aggregates.

original: mi chod ces bya ba ni rang gi rang bzhin ni ma bcos pas mi 'dor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi chod ces bya ba ni rang gi rang bzhin ni ma bcos pas mi 'dor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúUncuttable‚Äù means that its own nature is unfabricated, and therefore it is not discarded.

original: mi phyed pa zhes bya ba ni glo bur ba'i nyon mongs pa la sogs pa rnams kyis dbye bar mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mi phyed pa zhes bya ba ni glo bur ba'i nyon mongs pa la sogs pa rnams kyis dbye bar mi nus pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIndivisible‚Äù means that it cannot be divided by adventitious afflictions and so forth.

original: mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis mi gnod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis mi gnod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúUnchanging‚Äù means that it is not harmed by conceptual thoughts.

original: mi tshig pa dang zhes bya ba ni chos nyid la rtag tu de'i ngo bos gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi tshig pa dang zhes bya ba ni chos nyid la rtag tu de'i ngo bos gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúUnburnable‚Äù means that it always abides with its own nature in reality.

original: 'bigs zhes bya ba ni nang gi bdag nyid kyi mun pa'i tshogs la gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bigs zhes bya ba ni nang gi bdag nyid kyi mun pa'i tshogs la gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúPiercing‚Äù means that it is the antidote to the mass of inner darkness.

original: mchog ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: mchog ces bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúSupreme‚Äù means

original: mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu'i ngo bo'o //
translated: that it is the essence of the ultimate result.

original: 'dis ni chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid can gyi rdo rje la gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dis ni chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid can gyi rdo rje la gsungs so //
translated: This is said to be the vajra that has the nature of the dharmakƒÅya.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku'i ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the essence of the sa·πÉbhogakƒÅya,

original: sangs rgyas lnga'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas lnga'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the BhagavƒÅn] declares ‚Äúthe five buddhas,‚Äù and so on.

original: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnam pa lnga'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnam pa lnga'i ngo bo'o //

analyzed: ye shes @95b mchog dang rang bzhin zhes bya ba ni me long lta bu la sogs pa ye shes lnga'i rang bzhin gyi ngo bo'o //

original: rdo rje zhes ni brjod ces bya ba ni rdo rje'i sgras ni chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku gnyis bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rdo rje zhes ni brjod ces bya ba ni rdo rje'i sgras ni chos dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku gnyis bstan to zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: sprul pa'i sku'i ngo bo nyid brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku'i ngo bo nyid brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to express the nature of the Emanation Body,

original: snying rje ni sems can thams cad yongs su skyob par byed pa'i rnam pas sbyor ba ni snying rje sbyor bas so //
analyzed: snying rje ni sems can thams cad yongs su skyob par byed pa'i rnam pas sbyor ba ni snying rje sbyor bas so //

analyzed: de dang yang dag par sbyor ba ni 'grel pa'o //

original: mchog tu zhes bya ba ni mchog gi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: mchog tu zhes bya ba ni mchog gi rang bzhin no //

original: bde ba zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: bde ba zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis so //

original: ji lta bus she na /üîΩde'i phyir / de nyid gsum ni ro gcig pa //
analyzed: ji lta bus she na / de'i phyir / de nyid gsum ni ro gcig pa //

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /

analyzed: lus ngag yid gsum mi dmigs pa'i rnam pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

analyzed: de nyid gsum gyi ro gcig pa ni gcig tu gyur pa ste / de nyid ni don 'di la dgos pa yod pas na /

analyzed: de nyid gsum ni ro gcig pa'i don to // brjod bya rjod byed rnam par spangs //

original: zhes bya ba ni sgra dang rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi rnam par bstan pa zhes bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sgra dang rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi rnam par bstan pa zhes bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: bde chen zhes bya'i 'khor lo gnas //
analyzed: bde chen zhes bya'i 'khor lo gnas //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mgo bo'i gnas su gzhom du med pa las 'byung ba'i phyir de la gnas pa'o //

original: dbang po rnams kyi spyod yul min //
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyi spyod yul min //

original: zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa lnga'i yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa lnga'i yul ma yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

analyzed: mchog tu gnyis med rnal 'byor gyis // zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: de yang yin la rnal 'byor kyang yin pas te / rnal 'byor ni sbyor bas so //

original: dga' ba bzhi yi mtshan nyid can //
analyzed: dga' ba bzhi yi mtshan nyid can //

original: zhes bya ba ni dga' ba bzhi pa'i mtshan nyid can te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dga' ba bzhi pa'i mtshan nyid can te /

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩ'khor lo bzhi yi rim kyis thob //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir ro // 'khor lo bzhi yi rim kyis thob //

analyzed: ces bya ba ni sbrul pa la sogs pa 'khor lo bzhi la brten nas /

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bsnyen pa la sogs pa yan lag bzhi'i rim gyis nyams su myong bar gyur pa'o //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rtsa lnga'i nam mkha' la khyab par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //

original: stong nyid lnga'i bdag nyid kyi lam nas gang ba ni yongs su rdzogs pa'o //üîΩcha bzhi yis ni rnam par 'phel //
analyzed: stong nyid lnga'i bdag nyid kyi lam nas gang ba ni yongs su rdzogs pa'o // cha bzhi yis ni rnam par 'phel //

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni aom yig gis nor bu'i rtse mor byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir ro //

original: de'i cha bzhi yis aa'i yi ge dang / aom dang thig le dang / zla tshes kyi cha'i bdag nyid can gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i cha bzhi yis aa'i yi ge dang / aom dang thig le dang / zla tshes kyi cha'i bdag nyid can gyi phyir ro //

analyzed: aom yig kyang 'jug pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi phyir byang chub kyi sems nyid 'dzin pa'i thabs nyid bstan to //

original: de ltar rdo rje'i tshig rgyas par bshad pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar rdo rje'i tshig rgyas par bshad pa bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught the extensive explanation of the vajra words,üîΩin order to explain the extensive explanation of the sattva words, he

analyzed: sems dpa'i tshig rgyas par bshad pa'i phyir rdo rje rtse mor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

analyzed: thabs kyi yan lag gi rtse mo la'o // 'dzin pa ni rlung gi de kho na nyid kyi stobs kyis sam /
translated: At the tip of the branch of method.üîΩ‚ÄúHold‚Äù means to hold by the power of the reality of the vƒÅyu

analyzed: yi ge nye bar dgod pas gzung ba'o // sems dpa' zhes bya gtan la dbab //

original: ces bya ba ni sems dpa'i sgras brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni sems dpa'i sgras brjod par bya ste /

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: gang zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems kyis so //

original: 'di ni rdo rje sems dpa' brjod //
analyzed: 'di ni rdo rje sems dpa' brjod //

analyzed: bde ba chen po'i go 'phang zhes bya ba ni de 'dug pa'i gnas te /

analyzed: bzhi pa'i dga' bzhes bya ba ni dga' ba bzhi pa'i ngo bo lhan cig skyes pa zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: kun la khyab ces bya ba ni dga' ba la sogs pa thams cad la khyab byed nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú Pervading all‚Äù means that it abides as the pervader of all joys and so on.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /

analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'khor lo bzhis bsdus pa'am rtsa stong phrag @96b bdun cu rtsa gnyis kyi grangs kyis khyab pa rnams la'o //

original: de las skyes pa'o //

original: ji skad du /

analyzed: ji skad du /
